thread.title: Outrageous video: Females twerk on hood of police cruiser as cop crosses his arms and watches
thread.title_full: Outrageous video: Females twerk on hood of police cruiser as cop crosses his arms and watches

author: Dave Urbanski
title: Outrageous video: Females twerk on hood of police cruiser as cop crosses his arms and watches
text:
Tweet 
It‚Äôs one of those cellphone videos that needs more than one viewing ‚Äî just to be sure you actually watched what you think you just watched. 
But it‚Äôs true: Two females took turns twerking on the hood of a Rochester, New York, police cruiser as an officer stood in the background with his arms crossed watching. Image source: Twitter video screen cap 
The 16-second video, posted to Twitter on Saturday morning, shows one of the females moving from her hands and knees to actually standing atop the hood while twerking. Image source: Twitter video screen cap 
Her partner then merely rubs her rear end on the hood. Image source: Twitter video screen cap 
The clip ends with the first female jumping back into camera frame and firing off a final twerk on the street in front of the cruiser. Image source: Twitter video screen cap 
And while the uniformed officer stands with his arms crossed on the sidewalk, a second uniformed officer further away on the sidewalk appears to flip an object in his left hand: Rochester. NY. Let's get it. üåö pic.twitter.com/bsty28lYL5 
‚Äî The Protein Papi (@FollowZeLeader) February 25, 2017 
Police said the incident occurred during the officers‚Äô 11 p.m. Friday to 3 a.m. Saturday bar detail assignment. 
Rochester Police Chief Michael L. Ciminelli on Monday told TheBlaze in a statement that the result of the video is ‚Äúan inappropriate and unacceptable image for the Rochester Police Department‚Äù and that the issue has been ‚Äúaddressed.‚Äù 
The women approached the officers and asked if they could take a photo of themselves with the police car, Ciminelli said, adding that it‚Äôs a ‚Äúfairly common occurrence and we generally let people do this.‚Äù So the officers stepped away from the cruiser and ‚Äúwithout notice or warning, one of the women jumped on the police car,‚Äù the chief said. 
Ciminelli added that the officers were ‚Äúsurprised‚Äù and ‚Äúgiven the short duration of time the woman was on the car (estimated at 3-4 seconds) they did not have an opportunity to react.‚Äù 
Afterward the officers checked and confirmed there was no damage to the police car, the chief said, adding that the ‚Äúsupervisor then talked to the women and told them that what they did was not acceptable. The girls apologized and thanked the officers.‚Äù 
The twerking incident didn‚Äôt go down well with Bob Lonsberry, who hosts a morning radio talk show for Rochester station WHAM-AM. 
Lonsberry said the Rochester police force has become a ‚Äúdepartment of passivity so intent on respecting ‚Äòthe community‚Äô that it has none for itself‚Äù ‚Äî and blamed Mayor Lovely A. Warren and her ‚Äúcompliant‚Äù police chief for that. 
He added that the video is evidence of the department‚Äôs state and that Rochester police have been ‚Äúcastrated by three years of WTF leadership.‚Äù 
More from Lonsberry: 
And just yesterday, a fleeing 16-year-old ‚Äî a product of the piss-on-the-cops era ‚Äî popped off a couple of rounds at a Rochester officer who was chasing him. 
He missed. 
But they don‚Äôt always miss. 
The luck doesn‚Äôt always hold. 
TheBlaze on Monday spoke to a Rochester city media relations official who said the mayor‚Äôs office was deferring the matter to Rochester police.
